### 📹 Tour Recorder

The CodeTour recorder is how a repo maintainer can create new walkthroughs of the codebase. The recorder is made up of a few components:

* 💭 [Comment UX](./src/recorder/commands.ts) - Enables attaching new steps to lines of code, directories, etc.
* 📋 [Completion provider](./src/recorder/completionProvider.ts) - Provides completion support for authoring command links

### 📌 Intro

Hey 👋 Welcome to CodeTour! CodeTour is a VS Code extension that allows you to record and play back walkthroughs of your codebases. The CodeTour codebase itself is comprised of two main components:

* **Recorder:** Allows a repo maintainer/member to create a tour using a visual experience
* **Player:** Allows members of the repo to view a recorded tour

![Overview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/microsoft/codetour/main/overview.drawio.svg)

### 🎥 Tour Player

The CodeTour player is what defines the experience that end-users get, when actually taking a guided walkthrough. It includes various UX components:

* 🕳️ [Gutter decorator](./src/player/decorator.ts) - Displays the "CodeTour" icon next to lines that are associated with a tour
* 📊 [Status bar indicator](./src/player/status.ts) - Indicates the current tour and step
* 🌳 [Tree view](./src/player/tree/index.ts) - Provides an at-a-glance view of the tours within the opened workspace
